meanings.definition: The art or technique of painting on freshly spread, moist lime plaster with water-based pigments.
meanings.sent1: The frescoing in the church depicted scenes from the Bible.
meanings.sent2: The artist learned the traditional method of frescoing from a master painter.
meanings.sent3: The children tried frescoing on the sidewalk with colored chalk.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a canvas, frescoing memories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors used in frescoing brought the walls to life.

meanings.definition: The act of creating a fresco.
meanings.sent1: The frescoing of the mural took several days to complete.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate details in the frescoing of the cathedral.
meanings.sent3: The artist's cat interrupted his frescoing, leaving paw prints in the wet plaster.
meanings.sent4: His words were like brushes, frescoing a picture of hope in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The ancient civilization excelled in the art of frescoing their temples.

meanings.definition: The process of decorating a wall or ceiling with frescoes.
meanings.sent1: The royal palace underwent extensive frescoing to showcase its grandeur.
meanings.sent2: Visitors marveled at the intricate designs of the frescoing in the museum.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel added its own touch to the frescoing on the tree bark.
meanings.sent4: Time was the artist, slowly frescoing wrinkles on the face of the old building.
meanings.sent5: The master's skill in frescoing transformed the plain walls into works of art.
